etymology.description: semantic: 辵 (“walk”) + phonetic: 睘 (OC *ɡʷeŋ) – ‘to go back; to return’.
etymology.interpretation: The walking radical points to motion and the idea of going or coming back, while 睘 supplies the sound. Meanings later broadened in Mandarin to the adverbial senses ‘still/yet/also/fairly,’ though the historical core relates to returning movement.
etymology.simplification: Simplified by adopting the long-used abbreviated form 还 that omits the internal phonetic 睘, retaining 辶 and greatly reducing strokes.

examples.chinese: 我还在等你(我還在等你)。
这个价格还可以(這個價格還可以)。
他很累，却还坚持工作(他很累，卻還堅持工作)。
examples.pinyin: Tā hěn lèi, què hái jiānchí gōngzuò.
examples.english: He’s very tired, yet he still keeps working.
